customer_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna May Miller
site_name: Ervin Miller Marcus Miller Anna Mary Miller

citations.narrative:
Two adult dogs were observed to be missing their identification tags from their collars. Proper identification of each dog is
important for animal health and husbandry tracking. Ensure that each dog has his/her identification number properly
attached so that it can be identified in the records.
***Correct by August 15, 2025.

citations.desc: Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control.
citations.narrative:
-The larger of the exercise area that adult dogs use has overgrown weeds and grass. Overgrown weeds and grass make
the area difficult to observe dogs in it (to be sure they are secure), is difficult to clean, and can create areas for rodents
and pests to live in. Ensure that vegetation in the exercise area is controlled in a manner that allows cleaning of the area
and to protect the health and well-being of the dogs that use that area.
***Correct by August 9, 2025.
-The access way to the lower exercise area has a hole in the wall paneling that the dogs have chewed. This area could
cause injury and might not contain the dogs in the exercise area. Ensure to maintain the facility in good repair to protect
the health and well being of the dogs.
***Correct by August 11, 2025.

The licensee has not been keeping a record of de-worming and distemper and parvo vaccinations for adults (rabies
records were available). Records of treatments and vaccines and the date given for each dog must be kept and made
available for inspection. Ensure that medical records for each dog include all vaccines and treatments given.
***Correct from August 6, 2025 forward.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
n

narrative:
2.50(a)(1) 
   
Time and method of identification. 
Two adult dogs were observed to be missing their identification tags from their collars. Proper identification of each dog is 
important for animal health and husbandry tracking. Ensure that each dog has his/her identification number properly 
attached so that it can be identified in the records. 
***Correct by August 15, 2025. 
3.11(c) 
   
Cleaning, sanitization, housekeeping, and pest control. 
-The larger of the exercise area that adult dogs use has overgrown weeds and grass. Overgrown weeds and grass make 
the area difficult to observe dogs in it (to be sure they are secure), is difficult to clean, and can create areas for rodents 
and pests to live in. Ensure that vegetation in the exercise area is controlled in a manner that allows cleaning of the area 
and to protect the health and well-being of the dogs that use that area.  
***Correct by August 9, 2025. 
 
-The access way to the lower exercise area has a hole in the wall paneling that the dogs have chewed. This area could 
cause injury and might not contain the dogs in the exercise area. Ensure to maintain the facility in good repair to protect 
the health and well being of the dogs. 
***Correct by August 11, 2025. 
3.13(b)(3) 
   
Veterinary care for dogs. 
The licensee has not been keeping a record of de-worming and distemper and parvo vaccinations for adults (rabies 
records were available). Records of treatments and vaccines and the date given for each dog must be kept and made 
available for inspection. Ensure that medical records for each dog include all vaccines and treatments given.  
***Correct from August 6, 2025 forward. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.

n
